intro: Bonamia thunbergiana, commonly known as the common bonamia, is a flowering plant native to parts of East Asia, including China, Japan, and Korea. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring erect, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, ovate to elliptic in shape, and have a slightly rough texture. Bonamia thunbergiana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and stream banks.
